title: Animal transportation | Air Cargo News | Latest airfreight updates |
content:
Animal transport specialist Intradco Global has appointed Dennis Christen as global product manager for wildlife, zoological, and marine logistics

Equine and animal transport specialists Intradco Global managed the transportation of 1,200 breeding pigs from Denmark to the Philippines last month

UK-based animal transport service provider Animal Aircare has appointed Jake Holliday as its UK manager

Animal air transport demand is growing and airlines are investing to make sure they can fulfil their responsibilities to relocate animals to natural habitats, specialist facilities and zoos

In the latest news from the Air Cargo Europe trade show being held in Munich, Germany, this week (June 2-5 ), Maastricht Aachen Airport (MST) has announced a new partnership with equine transport specialist ECS Livestock.

Cargolux has offered to fly two rescue bears to the UK where they will live in an animal sanctuary on the country's south coast

Global air and travel services provider dnata will open a dedicated animal handling centre at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport (AMS) this summer

LATAM has transported an olive ridley turtle (Lepidochelys olivacea) within Chile to assist with a conservation initiative

DHL Express has flown critically endangered mountain bongo antelopes from Florida, US to a sanctuary in Kenya using one dedicated aircraft to transport all 17 of the animals

Magma Aviation and Intradco Global have transported 34 endurance horses from Liège, Belgium to AlUla, Saudi Arabia for the AlFursan Endurance Cup

The charter broker helped fly 58 cats across the US utilising a Metroliner III aircraft

Cathay Cargo has flown around 70 horses to Hong Kong for the Longines Hong Kong International Horse Show

An aircraft turbine, a red panda and unique artwork were amongst the most unusual shipments transported by Lufthansa Cargo in 2024.

DHL has revealed five of the most extraordinary shipments that it carried out in 2024

Chapman Freeborn has executed a series of urgent shipments of specialised automotive material from China to Europe

Time-critical logistics firm time:matters has opened an office in France as it looks to strengthen its presence in western Europe
